Wilson Plumbing & Drainage takes safety seriously and we encourage all persons representing the company to speak up if something is not right. If you find yourself unsure about something when it comes to safety, ASK! There is no such thing as a stupid question.
Sign Off – By signing this page you acknowledge your attendance of this toolbox meeting and your co-operation with our policies & procedures
Click to 'Add' signature's of each attendee
Reduced Pressure Zone Device - Double Check Valve
All "Flush Out Points" on the floor requires warning signage
Check Required volume to be flushed from each system - hot & cold - calculations can be found in "WPD Pipework Flushing Folder" for time durations per area

Cold Water System - Start by opening tap located furthest from the meters, open others on the way back & observe time to ensure system has been sufficiently drained. Open outside taps for enough time to empty volume of the main line, then flush each toilet the required amount to empty each branch.
Hot Water System - Start by opening tap located closest to end of the return line, open others on the way back & observe time to ensure system has been sufficiently drained.

Flushing showerheads & hoses - let the shower hang down (without touching the ground) it will let the water drain out afterwards. The water in a showerhead & hose when it sits there inside can become a risk and also causes scale buildup.
Faucets/taps with an aerator on it, should be removed during flushing, to allow the outlet to flush at high volume.
All taps turned off & area made safe
Final sign off - Pass when happy to proceed (Any issues please comment & Add photos below)

SCOPE - This Standard sets out requirements for the routine servicing (inspection, testing, preventive maintenance and survey) of Service systems and equipment

OBJECTIVE - The objective of this Standard is to maintain the reliability of Service systems and equipment such that they continue to meet the requirements of the approved design and are likely to do so until the next scheduled activity

APPLICATION - This Standard provides a systematic basis for minimum routine service applicable to Service systems and equipment. It also may be used to develop specific routine service requirements for systems or equipment that are part of an alternative solution. It requires evidence, in the form of records and reports of completion of the periodic inspection (including survey), testing and preventive maintenance activities required by this Standard
Wilson Plumbing & Drainage - Developed procedures for AS2304 compliance
